Class CamData

  • java.lang.Object
    • CamData

  • public class CamData
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains most of the Image Extraction files.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      org.opencv.videoio.VideoCapture caprun
      caprun is the videocapture for the dynamic class
      org.opencv.core.Mat[] eye0Samples
      eyeSamples contains an array with our sample eye set from calibration the Coordinates can be accessed using the array id for each eyes contains eye 0
      org.opencv.core.Mat[] eye1Samples
      eyeSamples contains an array with our sample eye set from calibration the Coordinates can be accessed using the array id for each eyes contains eye 1
      org.opencv.ml.KNearest knn0
      knn instance of the CamData instance used to Estimate the Gaze after training it with Calibration Data One instance for each eye – knn0 and knn1 for eyes 0 and 1
      org.opencv.ml.KNearest knn1 
      int[] xCoords
      The xCoords array has the x Coords for each eye with the same array id
      int[] yCoords
      The yCoords array has the y Coords for each eye with the same array id

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CamData()
      CamData class instance constructor The sample size will be increased with each successful .save() call Initialized with size 0
      CamData(int size)
      CamData class instance constructor with size (preferred)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean checkForEyes()
      special function required for looping inside GUI and exiting by closing eyes (doesn't work) returns true if eyes have been detected or returns false if eyes haven't been detected for more than 15 (default) iteration
      static int[] combine2(int[] eye0, int[] eye1)
      combine two coordinate array [x,y] and [x,y] into one by interpolating them
      static void debugCamView()
      This shows only the web cam image in a window until something happens
      void debugExistingEyes()
      Creates windows with all eyes from calibration sample This instance method is for debugging purposes and creates many eye windows and lists their coords
      static void debugFaceEyesImprovedView()
      Shows the Camera view with detected face if detected and detected eyes (improved) if detected uses the same parameters as .getEyesImproved, made for debugging and etc
      void debugFaceEyesImprovedViewRun()
      same as static debugFaceEyesImprovedView but with run (requires startRunning()) and is non-static Shows the Camera view with detected face if detected and detected eyes (improved) if detected uses the same parameters as .getEyesImproved, made for debugging and etc
      static void debugFaceEyesView()
      Shows the Camera view with detected face if detected and detected eyes if detected uses the same parameters as .getEyes, made for debugging and etc
      static void debugFaceView()
      Shows the Camera View with the Detected face marked with a square, if detected
      void debugGuessFaceEyesImprovedViewRun()
      same as debugFaceEyesImprovedVIew() but with the guess being drawn on top considered a failure since imshow can't cooperate with swing without
      static org.opencv.core.Mat debugMatFaceEyesImprovedView()
      Same as debugFaceEyesImprovedView but returns mat only once Shows the Camera view with detected face if detected and detected eyes (improved) if detected uses the same parameters as .getEyesImproved, made for debugging and etc
      static void debugScaledOnlyEyesImprovedView(int scale)
      This function displays only eyes from getEyesImprovedRun() continuously scaled in one window
      int distance(int id1, int id2)
      calculates the euclidian distance between the two 2d CamData point ID coordinates
      static org.opencv.core.Mat[] getEyes()
      TODO: make this more usable This static method returns two eyes from the cam from the face in a Mat array of size 2.
      static org.opencv.core.Mat[] getEyesImproved()
      this is the currently used method for extracting eyes This static method returns two eyes from the cam from the face in a Mat array of size 2.
      org.opencv.core.Mat[] getEyesImprovedRun()
      same as the static method getEyesImproved but has to be run from a non-static instance IF IT DOES NOT FIND EYES IN 500 ITERATIONS IT RETURNS NULL because of requirement
      org.opencv.core.Mat[] getEyesImprovedRunWithCounter()
      special method for checkForEyes() that counts the number of failed attempts of capturing eyes
      static org.opencv.core.Mat getFace()
      Returns a Mat::face WHEN it is detected, otherwise loops until there is a face; This static function gets an image from the web cam, and returns a face in grayscale.
      static org.opencv.core.Mat getFaceNow()
      Returns a face if detected immediately, otherwise returns null This static function gets an image from the web cam, and returns a face in grayscale.
      int[] getGuessKnn3()
      calls getGuessKnn3 with default values 160 and returns the 3 closest neighbours
      int[] getGuessKnn3(int size)
      returns the 3 nearest neighbours coordinates as [x1,y1, x2,y2, x3,y3] the first neighbours are the closest
      int[] getGuessMat(int size, org.opencv.core.Mat[] eyes) 
      int[] getGuessRun()
      Returns the prediction for the current view position this method is the default prediction coordiantes method that returns coordinates
      int[] getGuessRun(int size)
      this instance method is used to get the guessed coordinates of the immediate eye capture requires startRunning() to be executed before starting this method usually combines three coords but sometimes rejects one result if too far away never rejects thefirst guess tho because first
      static org.opencv.core.Mat getMat()
      The static getMat method is supposed to return the Mat variable with the WebCam image data.
      int getSize()
      Shows size (LENGTH) of sample dataset
      boolean initializeKNearest()
      This method has to be called before actual tracking but after calibration Summarizes and feeds the saved eyes of the instance to the ML Algorithm InitializeKNearest with the default size of 160
      boolean initializeKNearest(int size)
      This method initializes the K-Nearest Neighbour ML instance It adds the calibration samples from the CamData instance to the KNN-Network needs to be called AFTER calibration BEFORE tracking
      int[] interP(int firstID, int secondID, int thirdID)
      Interpolates the calibration coordinates of guessed 3 neighbours, that are given as ID
      int[] interP2(int firstID, int secondID)
      interpolates the coorinates of two point IDs and returns an array of [x, y]
      void startRunning()
      Opens VideoCapture device for capture Usually is required for non-static methods with "Run" improves capturing speed immensely Required for getEyesImprovedRun() Recommended for multiple eye captures Needs to be closed after capture with .stopRunnint()
      void stopRunning()
      Closes VideoCapture device for capture Does not really have to be used but can close the capture device Usually used after getEyesImprovedRun() loop done

      • CamData

        public CamData()
        CamData class instance constructor The sample size will be increased with each successful .save() call Initialized with size 0

      • CamData

        public CamData(int size)
        CamData class instance constructor with size (preferred)
        Parameters:
        size - of the data set (number of points) If sample size will be more than data set it will be increased with each successful .save() call

    • Method Detail

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
        Shows size (LENGTH) of sample dataset
        Returns:
        int size – number of samples so far

      • startRunning

        public void startRunning()
        Opens VideoCapture device for capture Usually is required for non-static methods with "Run" improves capturing speed immensely Required for getEyesImprovedRun() Recommended for multiple eye captures Needs to be closed after capture with .stopRunnint()

      • stopRunning

        public void stopRunning()
        Closes VideoCapture device for capture Does not really have to be used but can close the capture device Usually used after getEyesImprovedRun() loop done

      • getMat

        public static org.opencv.core.Mat getMat()
        The static getMat method is supposed to return the Mat variable with the WebCam image data. Could be made private in the future. Could be made more functional with the addition of another overloading method with a param, in order to, for example, show the image or send image information.
        Returns:
        a Mat type variable with the webcam data

      • getFaceNow

        public static org.opencv.core.Mat getFaceNow()
        Returns a face if detected immediately, otherwise returns null This static function gets an image from the web cam, and returns a face in grayscale. This function captures an image from the web cam
        Returns:
        one detected Mat::face from web cam in grayscale if detected, otherwise null

      • getFace

        public static org.opencv.core.Mat getFace()
        Returns a Mat::face WHEN it is detected, otherwise loops until there is a face; This static function gets an image from the web cam, and returns a face in grayscale. This function captures an image from the web cam
        Returns:
        one detected Mat::face from web cam in grayscale when detected.

      • getEyes

        public static org.opencv.core.Mat[] getEyes()
        TODO: make this more usable This static method returns two eyes from the cam from the face in a Mat array of size 2. It keeps capturing until it gets two eyes; This method keeps capturing cam pictures until it detects a face, then it tries to find 2 or more eyes, if it doesn't, it asks for the next face. When it finds the two or more eyes on the n-th face Mat it returns the eyes in an Array
        Returns:
        Mat[2]::eyes

      • getEyesImproved

        public static org.opencv.core.Mat[] getEyesImproved()
        this is the currently used method for extracting eyes This static method returns two eyes from the cam from the face in a Mat array of size 2. It keeps capturing until it gets two eyes; This method keeps capturing cam pictures until it detects a face, then it removes the lower half of the picture, divides the upper two parts in two, searches each half of the upper half for one eye, then returns two eyes if two eyes are found in a Mat[] array IF IT DOES NOT FIND EYES IN 500 ITERATIONS IT RETURNS NULL because of requirement
        Returns:
        Mat[2]::eyes

      • getEyesImprovedRun

        public org.opencv.core.Mat[] getEyesImprovedRun()
        same as the static method getEyesImproved but has to be run from a non-static instance IF IT DOES NOT FIND EYES IN 500 ITERATIONS IT RETURNS NULL because of requirement
        Returns:
        returns a mat array of eyes MIGHT RETURN NULL BE CAREFUL

        public static void debugFaceEyesImprovedView()

      • debugFaceEyesImprovedViewRun

        public void debugFaceEyesImprovedViewRun()

      • debugScaledOnlyEyesImprovedView

        public static void debugScaledOnlyEyesImprovedView(int scale)
        This function displays only eyes from getEyesImprovedRun() continuously scaled in one window
        Parameters:
        scale - is the size of one eye (window will have two)

      • debugExistingEyes

        public void debugExistingEyes()
        Creates windows with all eyes from calibration sample This instance method is for debugging purposes and creates many eye windows and lists their coords

      • initializeKNearest

        public boolean initializeKNearest(int size)
        This method initializes the K-Nearest Neighbour ML instance It adds the calibration samples from the CamData instance to the KNN-Network needs to be called AFTER calibration BEFORE tracking
        Returns:
        true when finished (knn0 and knn1 successfully trained), false if 0 elements in the instance or if at least one knn not trained

      • initializeKNearest

        public boolean initializeKNearest()
        This method has to be called before actual tracking but after calibration Summarizes and feeds the saved eyes of the instance to the ML Algorithm InitializeKNearest with the default size of 160
        Returns:
        the same as initializeKNearest(size)

      • interP

        public int[] interP(int firstID,
                    int secondID,
                    int thirdID)
        Interpolates the calibration coordinates of guessed 3 neighbours, that are given as ID
        Parameters:
        firstID - the first neighbour ID that was returned by the knn
        secondID - the second neighbour ID that was returned by the knn
        thirdID - the third neighbour ID that was returned by the knn
        Returns:
        the interpolated guessed coordinates as an int[]{xCoord,yCoord}

      • interP2

        public int[] interP2(int firstID,
                     int secondID)
        interpolates the coorinates of two point IDs and returns an array of [x, y]
        Parameters:
        firstID - first point ID
        secondID - second point ID
        Returns:
        the coorinates between them in an int[] of size 2

      • getGuessRun

        public int[] getGuessRun()
        Returns the prediction for the current view position this method is the default prediction coordiantes method that returns coordinates
        Returns:
        coordinates

      • getGuessRun

        public int[] getGuessRun(int size)
        this instance method is used to get the guessed coordinates of the immediate eye capture requires startRunning() to be executed before starting this method usually combines three coords but sometimes rejects one result if too far away never rejects thefirst guess tho because first
        Returns:
        an int[] array of guessed interpolated coordinates of both eyes [xCoord, yCoord] (might be changed)

      • combine2

        public static int[] combine2(int[] eye0,
                             int[] eye1)
        combine two coordinate array [x,y] and [x,y] into one by interpolating them
        Parameters:
        eye0 - the first coordinate array
        eye1 - the second coordinate array
        Returns:
        the combined interpolated coordinate array [x,y]

        public void debugGuessFaceEyesImprovedViewRun()

      • getGuessMat

        public int[] getGuessMat(int size,
                         org.opencv.core.Mat[] eyes)
        Returns:
        a Mat of a picture and overlayed detected viewpoint.

      • getGuessKnn3

        public int[] getGuessKnn3()
        calls getGuessKnn3 with default values 160 and returns the 3 closest neighbours
        Returns:
        returns the same as getGuessKnn3(160);

      • getGuessKnn3

        public int[] getGuessKnn3(int size)
        returns the 3 nearest neighbours coordinates as [x1,y1, x2,y2, x3,y3] the first neighbours are the closest

      • checkForEyes

        public boolean checkForEyes()
        special function required for looping inside GUI and exiting by closing eyes (doesn't work) returns true if eyes have been detected or returns false if eyes haven't been detected for more than 15 (default) iteration
        Returns:

      • getEyesImprovedRunWithCounter

        public org.opencv.core.Mat[] getEyesImprovedRunWithCounter()
        special method for checkForEyes() that counts the number of failed attempts of capturing eyes
        Returns:
        false as soon as there are at least 15 times without two captured eyes

      • distance

        public int distance(int id1,
                    int id2)
        calculates the euclidian distance between the two 2d CamData point ID coordinates
        Parameters:
        id1 - first point ID
        id2 - second point ID
        Returns:
        distance
